title: Liverpool vs. Brentford: Preview
sub_title: Arne Slot oversaw victory on Premier League bow away at Ipswich
body: Anfield gets its first look of Arne Slot's Liverpool in the Premier League on Sunday afternoon when the Reds take on Brentford.

title: Bayern Munich vs. VfL Wolfsburg: Super Cup Preview
sub_title: Frauen-Bundesliga champions, Bayern Munich, square off with DFB Pokal champions, Wolfsburg, in the Super Cup on Sunday evening
body: From training camp straight to the Supercup… The She-Wolves came back from pre-season training at the Klosterpforte Hotel in Harsewinkel on Friday, and after just one night at home and a final training session in Wolfsburg, they’re back on the road and heading to Dresden.

title: Wolves vs. Chelsea: Preview
sub_title: Blues beat Servette in midweek after losing Premier League opener to Manchester City
body: It has been a busy start to Enzo Maresca's reign. After succumbing to Manchester City on the opening weekend of the 2024/25 season, the Blues toppled Servette 2-0 in the first leg of their Conference League play-off on Thursday.

title: Frauen-Bundesliga Super Cup: Silverware at stake in opener
sub_title: VfL Wolfsburg face FC Bayern Munich in the Google Pixel Supercup on Sunday
body: The introduction of the Google Pixel Supercup means the reigning Bundesliga champions and DFB Cup winners both have an opportunity to get their hands on silverware in their opening game of the new season.

title: Haaland scores hat-trick as Man City beat Ipswich after early scare
sub_title: Erling Haaland has scored four goals in two league games this season
body: Erling Haaland scored a hat-trick as Manchester City showed Ipswich just how tough life in the Premier League can be with a comfortable victory at Etihad Stadium.

title: Arsenal's second half surge sinks bogey side Villa
sub_title: Leandro Trossard put Arsenal ahead against Aston Villa at Villa Park
body: Arsenal survived their latest severe examination from bogey side Aston Villa to emerge with a statement victory after a thunderous encounter at Villa Park.

title: Brighton score 95th minute winner to beat Man United
sub_title: Joao Pedro's late winner means Brighton have won their first two competitive games under new boss Fabian Hurzeler
body: Joao Pedro headed home a dramatic 95th-minute winner for Brighton who extended their 100% start to the season at the expense of Manchester United.

title: Yamal, Lewandowski help Barcelona beat Athletic
sub_title: Lamine Yamal is continuing the form he showed with Spain at Euro 2024
body: Lamine Yamal scored his first La Liga goal of the season as Barcelona battled to a narrow win over Athletic Bilbao at the Olympic Stadium.

title: Cancellieri scores late as Parma stun AC Milan
sub_title: Matteo Cancellieri scored a late winner as newly promoted Parma stunned AC Milan in Serie A
body: Pontus Almqvist's pinpoint ball into the box found fellow second-half substitute Cancellieri, who finished into the bottom corner.

title: Brighton vs. Man United: Preview
sub_title: Erik ten Hag still needs improvements as Manchester United head to Brighton for Saturday’s early Premier League kick-off
body: United were saved by new hero Joshua Zirkzee as the forward announced his arrival from Bologna with an 87th-minute winner against Fulham in the opening game. That late intervention snatched a 1-0 victory at Old Trafford last Friday.

title: Man City vs. Ipswich: Preview
sub_title: Manchester City host newly-promoted Ipswich Town on Saturday afternoon
body: Ipswich Town couldn't have been handed a much more challenging start to life back in the Premier League as they follow up their opener against Liverpool with a trip to Manchester City.

title: Aston Villa vs. Arsenal: Preview
sub_title: Aston Villa welcome title hopefuls Arsenal to Villa Park in huge early-season fixture
body: Revenge is on the menu for Arsenal as they travel to Aston Villa for their second Premier League outing of the season on Saturday evening.

title: NWSL's groundbreaking deal set to revolutionize women's soccer
sub_title: NWSL Reshapes the Future: A Deal That Will Make the League a Global Icon by 2030!
body: The National Women's Soccer League, the US' top-tier women's league, is on the cusp of a new era of fortune, inking a new collective bargaining agreement with its Players Association.

title: Guardiola 'happy' hearing over Man City charges starts soon
sub_title: An independent disciplinary commission is set to hear the case against City over alleged breaches of Premier League financial rules
body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola is "happy" that a hearing into the 115 charges facing the club will begin soon.

title: Bellingham injured in lead-up to England games
sub_title: The 21-year-old was unable to finish a club session on Friday
body: Real Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham has sustained a calf injury in training just over two weeks before England begin their Nations League campaign.

title: Bundesliga: Wirtz scores 101st minute winner for Leverkusen
sub_title: Leverkusen finished 17 points ahead of Stuttgart to win the Bundesliga last season, with Bayern Munich third
body: Florian Wirtz scored a dramatic winner from a penalty rebound in the 11th minute of stoppage time as Bayer Leverkusen began their Bundesliga title defence with victory against Borussia Monchengladbach.

title: Trippier asks to leave Newcastle before window closes
sub_title: Kieran Trippier has asked to leave Newcastle and, although Eddie Howe wants the England right-back to stay at St James’ Park, there is a sense that the 33-year-old will depart, quite possibly on loan, before the end of the month
body: After joining Newcastle for £12m from Atlético Madrid in January 2022, Trippier has been a cornerstone of Howe’s squad, both on and off the pitch. Everton has been mentioned as a possible destination.

title: Valencia emerge as candidates to sign out of favour Atletico Madrid starlet
sub_title: Atletico Madrid now have Koke Resurreccion, Rodrigo De Paul, Conor Gallagher and Pablo Barrios as options in the centre of midfield, which makes it very difficult for Arthur Vermeeren to have prominence this season
body: Bayer Leverkusen and RB Leipzig have both registered their interest in Vermeeren, but it’s likely that Atleti would prefer he remains in La Liga – this way, he would be able to adapt to Spanish football quicker.

title: West Ham nearing €23m agreement to sign PSG’s Carlos Soler
sub_title: West Ham United and Paris Saint-Germain are nearing a €23m agreement for the transfer of PSG midfielder Carlos Soler
body: The 27-year-old is yet to agree on personal terms with the Hammers but the outlet understands that Soler may sign a four-year deal with Julen Lopetegui’s side.

title: Dybala commits to Roma – rejects $83M Saudi league offer
sub_title: Argentina star Paulo Dybala announced on Thursday that he would remain with AS Roma, ending weeks of speculation linking him with a lucrative move to Saudi Pro League club Al Qadsiah
body: Multiple reports indicate that Dybala turned down an offer of €75 million ($83M) over three years.

title: Mikel Merino set to sign for Arsenal after Real Sociedad accept £32m offer
sub_title: Arsenal are set to complete the ­signing of Mikel Merino after Real Sociedad accepted an offer for the Spain midfielder worth over £32m
body: Negotiations over a deal for the 28-year-old have been taking place for several weeks with Sociedad’s president insisting Arsenal must match their asking price for Merino.

title: Chelsea beat Servette in Conference League play-off first leg
sub_title: Christopher Nkunku's penalty helped Enzo Maresca earn his first win as Chelsea boss as the Blues secured a two-goal advantage against Servette in their Conference League play-off first leg
body: A much-changed Chelsea side had been struggling to open up their Swiss opponents until Nkunku was sent sprawling by goalkeeper Jeremy Frick early in the second half.

title: Bobby Clark reunited with Lijnders at RB Salzburg as Liverpool sell for £10m
sub_title: Liverpool have sold Bobby Clark, one of the young stars of last season’s Carabao Cup final victory, to RB Salzburg in a £10m deal
body: The 19-year-old midfielder made 12 appearances for Jürgen Klopp’s team last season and was highly regarded by the former Liverpool manager and his assistant, Pepijn Lijnders.

title: Fulham sign Burnley midfielder Berge for £25m
sub_title: Fulham have signed Burnley midfielder Sander Berge in a £25m deal
body: The Norway international has penned a five-year deal at Craven Cottage and the club have the option of extending that by a further 12 months.

title: West Ham keen on move for PSG’s Carlos Soler but need player sales first
sub_title: West Ham’s hopes of strengthening their midfield by signing Carlos Soler from Paris Saint-Germain are likely to depend on whether they can raise funds through sales before the transfer window shuts
body: Early talks have been held over a move for Soler, who is valued by PSG at around £20m, but West Ham are keeping a careful watch on their finances after a heavy summer of spending.

title: John Textor agreement over Everton takeover expected by end of week
sub_title: John Textor is in Liverpool to hold further talks with Everton’s owner, Farhad Moshiri, over a proposed takeover of the club, with a deal expected to be agreed by the end of the week
body: The American billionaire became the third party to be granted a period of exclusivity by Blue Heaven Holdings, the company that owns Everton, last week after renewing his efforts to purchase a majority stake in the Premier League club having initially been overlooked by Moshiri in favour of the Friedkin Group.

title: Barcelona keeping tabs on Manchester United winger Jadon Sancho
sub_title: Barcelona are determined to sign a new winger before the transfer window closes later this month
body: At this stage, the favourite to join is Juventus’ Federico Chiesa, although many other options are being considered by Deco, the club’s sporting director.

title: Arsenal back in €100m Osimhen chase
sub_title: Arsenal are back in the race for Napoli striker Victor Osimhen, claim reports in Italy, and would be prepared to pay €100m for the Chelsea and Paris Saint-Germain target
body: The Partenopei agreed with the Nigeria international when he signed a lucrative new contract in December 2023 that he would be sold this summer, but nobody has come anywhere near to the €130m release clause.

title: Forest sign left-back Moreno on loan from Villa
sub_title: Nottingham Forest have signed Aston Villa left-back Alex Moreno on loan for the rest of the season, with an option for a permanent deal
body: The Spaniard, 31, had fallen behind behind new signing Ian Maatsen and Lucas Digne in the pecking order at Villa Park.

title: Milan’s Pierre Kalulu loaned out to Juventus
sub_title: AC Milan centre-back Pierre Kalulu (24) has been loaned out to Serie A rivals Juventus FC, both clubs have announced
body: The 24-year-old only featured nine times for the Rossoneri last campaign with his season derailed by injuries.

title: Chelsea confirm end of Joao Felix career at Atletico Madrid after five seasons
sub_title: Atletico Madrid’s record signing Joao Felix has left the club for a third and final time, joining Chelsea after successive loan spells at Stamford Bridge and then Barcelona
body: It brings to an end a turbulent five-year stint in Madrid.

title: Fulham set to sign Crystal Palace defender Andersen
sub_title: Fulham are set to sign Crystal Palace centre-back Joachim Andersen for about £30m.
body: The Cottagers have pursued Andersen throughout the summer transfer window and had an initial bid rejected as Palace sought a fee close to £40m.

title: Atletico Madrid confirm Conor Gallagher signing from Chelsea
sub_title: Atletico Madrid have confirmed the signing of Chelsea midfielder on a five-year deal, with the 24-year-old England international already training with his new teammates
body: The deal is believed to be worth around €42m to Chelsea, with Joao Felix expected to head the other way.

title: Manchester City working on Gundogan deal
sub_title: Manchester City are working on a deal that could bring midfielder Ilkay Gundogan back to the club
body: The 33-year-old left City for Barcelona in 2023 after captaining Pep Guardiola's side to their historic Treble.

title: Liverpool close to signing Valencia's Mamardashvili
sub_title: Liverpool are closing in on their first signing of the Arne Slot era after stepping up talks with Valencia for goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili
body: Valencia and Liverpool are discussing a fee in the region of €40 million for the 6 feet 6 inches Georgia international, but while a deal has not yet been finalised, negotiations are moving towards a successful conclusion.

title: Atletico Madrid to make one final attempt to sign leading defensive target
sub_title: Atletico Madrid are set to seal the long-awaited signing of Conor Gallagher in the coming days, and he will become the fourth big-money arrival at the Civitas Metropolitano, after Robin Le Normand, Alexander Sorloth and Julian Alvarez. However, he’s unlikely to be the last
body: With 10 days to go until the transfer window closes, Atleti are still on the lookout for a new left-sided central defender. They’ve had David Hancko as their top target all summer, but until now, an agreement has yet to be reached with Feyenoord.

title: Barcelona given transfer boost in chase for Juventus outcast Chiesa
sub_title: Sky Sport Italia reports that a move to a foreign club is the most realistic option for Juventus outcast Federico Chiesa, who sees Barcelona as the best possible destination
body: Federico Chiesa’s agent, Fali Ramadani, has opened talks with Barcelona in an attempt to leave Juventus before the end of the summer transfer window.

title: Brazilian police end their investigation into Antony allegations
sub_title: The Brazilian police investigation into allegations of violence against the Manchester United winger Antony has been dropped by the Sao Paulo civil police “without indictment”, his legal representative has stated
body: Antony, who denied the allegations, is understood to have voluntarily been interviewed by Brazilian police last June. The winger, who was not arrested or charged, was also the subject of a Greater Manchester police investigation.

title: Sterling left out of Chelsea squad for European game
sub_title: Raheem Sterling has been left out of Chelsea's squad for their Europa Conference League play-off first leg with Servette
body: Thursday's game is the second in succession the 29-year-old England forward has not featured in a matchday squad, after he was omitted from Chelsea's Premier League opener with Manchester City.

title: Foden named PFA player of year – Palmer young player
sub_title: Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden has won the Professional Footballers' Association men's player of the year award, while Chelsea winger Cole Palmer was named young player of the year
body: It is the first time since the 2009-10 campaign that both men's awards have gone to English players.

title: Manchester United hope to force PSG into lowering Manuel Ugarte’s asking price
sub_title: Manchester United are willing to wait until transfer deadline day to try to sign Manuel Ugarte
body: There does not have to be any outgoings to finance the deal, although Paris ­Saint-­Germain’s £51m valuation of the Uruguay midfielder is deemed too high by United and there is belief that the French champions may reduce it as the deadline nears.

title: Burnley accept Fulham's £25m Berge bid
sub_title: Burnley midfielder Sander Berge is set to have a medical with Fulham on Tuesday after the Clarets accepted a £25m bid for the Norway international
body: Marco Silva's side have agreed to pay an initial £20m, with a further £5m in add-ons.

title: Still no Roma response from Dybala after lucrative Al-Qadsiah offer
sub_title: Both Roma and Al-Qadsiah are still waiting to hear back from Argentina star Paulo Dybala, who received a lucrative contract offer from the Saudi Pro League side last week
body: La Joya has reportedly been offered a three-year contract in a deal worth around €20m in wages per season.

title: Agreement reached between PSG and Ademola Lookman
sub_title: Paris Saint-Germain have reached a salary agreement with Ademola Lookman (26)
body: However, PSG are yet to be fully convinced of finalising a deal for the Atalanta BC forward as the French champions are expected to explore all their options before committing to the Lookman transfer.

title: Wolves make loan bid for Arsenal keeper Ramsdale
sub_title: Wolves have made an offer to sign Arsenal goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale on a season-long loan deal
body: The bid, which was submitted on Monday, includes an option to make the move permanent in 2025.

title: Manchester City keen to bring back Ilkay Gündogan from Barcelona
sub_title: Manchester City are interested in bringing back their former club captain Ilkay Gündogan from Barcelona
body: The German midfielder left City just over a year ago but wants to leave the Catalan club, opening up the opportunity of a return to the ­Premier League, although there is interest from Turkey and Saudi Arabia.

title: Chelsea agree Felix fee with Gallagher set to join Atletico
sub_title: Chelsea have agreed a fee in principle for Atletico Madrid forward Joao Felix, with Conor Gallagher moving in the other direction as part of the deal
body: The fee for the 24-year-old Portugal international is undisclosed, but it will allow him to return to Stamford Bridge on a six-year deal with an option for a further season.

title: Brighton sign Leeds’ Georginio Rutter in €47m club-record transfer
sub_title: Brighton and Hove Albion FC have signed French striker Georginio Rutter (22) from Leeds United, both clubs have announced
body: The Seagulls have triggered the Frenchman’s release clause, which reportedly rises to €47m. Rutter is therefore Brighton’s club-record signing.

title: Thiago Motta hails Juventus performances from young talents
sub_title: Thiago Motta was not surprised by Samuel Mbangula scoring on his shock debut as Juventus crushed Como 3-0, but outlined how Dusan Vlahovic and Kenan Yildiz combined upfront
body: The Bianconeri had stuttered in pre-season and there were doubts as to what the real identity of this team would be under a very different coach to predecessor Max Allegri.

title: Julian Alvarez makes debut in Atletico thriller
sub_title: Atletico manager Diego Simeone handed debuts to star signings Robin Le Normand and Alexander Sorloth, with Julian Alvarez coming off the bench in a thrilling clash against Villareal
body: Los Rojiblancos wrought havoc down the right side, with Samuel Lino forcing a good save out of Diego Conde, and then Reinildo Mandava having a goal ruled out.

title: Veteran Vardy earns Leicester draw against wasteful Tottenham
sub_title: The evergreen Jamie Vardy marked his return to the Premier League with a goal as promoted Leicester held Tottenham to a draw at King Power Stadium
body: Vardy, 37, scored with the hosts first shot on target, nodding in Abdul Fatawu's cross from close range just before the hour mark.

title: Maresca to decide Sterling’s Chelsea future
sub_title: Enzo Maresca offered Raheem ­Sterling no assurances over his future after making the surprise decision to drop the winger when Chelsea began their season with a 2-0 defeat against Manchester City on Sunday, Erling Haaland and Mateo Kovacic scoring the goals
body: Sterling, who has said through his representatives that he is looking for “clarity” over his status at Stamford Bridge, is one of several players who could be sold before the transfer window shuts this month.

title: Ivan Toney left out of Brentford squad because of ‘transfer interest’ in striker
sub_title: Thomas Frank has insisted Ivan Toney accepted the decision to leave him out of Brentford’s opening game of the season against Crystal Palace after revealing “there’s a lot of transfer interest” in the England striker
body: Toney has entered the final year of his contract and made no secret of his desire to leave Brentford, with Arsenal, Chelsea and the Saudi Pro League side al-Ahli having all been linked with him this summer.

title: PSG and Al-Ahli set to compete for Atalanta’s Ademola Lookman
sub_title: Paris Saint-Germain have made contact with Ademola Lookman (26) and pushing hard for a deal
body: The Atalanta BC forward is keen to leave the club this summer which has reportedly annoyed the club ahead of their opening fixture tomorrow afternoon against US Lecce.

title: Chelsea's Enzo Maresca defends choice to captain Enzo Fernández
sub_title: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca has defended his decision to select Enzo Fernández as captain just a month after the Argentina midfielder posted a video containing an allegedly racist chant
body: Fernández wore the armband as Chelsea were beaten 2-0 by Manchester City in their Premier League opener at Stamford Bridge on Sunday.

title: Man City open title defence with victory at Chelsea
sub_title: Erling Haaland scored on his 100th Manchester City appearance as the Premier League champions began their title defence with a win against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge
body: Haaland opened the scoring on 18 minutes with a dinked finish over Robert Sanchez for his 91st City goal since joining from Borussia Dortmund in 2022.

title: Mbappe frustrated in Mallorca as Real Madrid draw La Liga opener
sub_title: Los Blancos were left frustrated in Palma as Kylian Mbappe’s long awaited La Liga debut ended in a tie in the Balearics
body: With so much attention on Mbappe’s big night in Mallorca, Real Madrid looked on course for a routine win, as Rodrygo Goes fired home an early breakthrough.

title: Napoli ‘melted like snow in the sun’ during ‘unacceptable’ second half
sub_title: Antonio Conte takes full responsibility for his side’s 3-0 humbling away to Hellas Verona in their opening match of the 2024-25 Serie A season, but feels like his side ‘melted like snow in the sun’ during a humiliating second half experience at the Bentegodi stadium
body: Conte apologised to the travelling Partenopei supporters for what he labelled an ‘unacceptable’ second-half showing.
